meanings.definition: A small North American tree or shrub with bitter, astringent fruit.
meanings.sent1: The chokecherry tree in the park has small, red fruits.
meanings.sent2: I picked some chokecherries from the tree for a snack.
meanings.sent3: The birds had a party in the chokecherry tree, eating all the fruits!
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned as red as a ripe chokecherry when she blushed.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of a chokecherry is unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The small, dark red fruit of the chokecherry tree.
meanings.sent1: The chokecherry fruit is tart and not very sweet.
meanings.sent2: I made a delicious jam using chokecherries from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel looked guilty with red juice all over its face from the chokecherry feast.
meanings.sent4: Her lips were as red as chokecherries after eating the fruit.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of chokecherries filled the kitchen as she cooked.

meanings.definition: To choke or suffocate on a chokecherry pit.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to chokecherry on the pit while eating the fruit.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally chokecherried on a pit and had to cough it out.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to chokecherry on a pit to make her friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The truth seemed to chokecherry in his throat as he tried to speak.
meanings.sent5: The words seemed to chokecherry out of her mouth in a rush.
